app.revision_history: Adds -hold and -setup to the get_timing_paths command in validate_timing
app.name: junit
app.summary: The JUnit App is built with 3 layers of APIs. The high level API enables a user to run generic tests or a group of predefined tests on demand. The intermediate level API enables a user to call assertions and customize the tests. Both the high level and intermediate level APIs are automatically generating a JUnit report in memory. The low level API enables the user to work directly with the "data graph" in memory. There is a section in the writer class where this in-memory "data graph" is converted to a "junit graph". The "junit graph" is then just dumped to an XML file. The conversion from "data graph" to "junit graph" exists to enable users to convert the data to other formats.

proc.name: assert_exists
proc.summary: Asserts that all files exist.

proc.name: assert_same
proc.summary: Asserts that two values are the same, else a failure is logged.

proc.name: format_junit
proc.summary: Converts the results of the in-memory data object to JUnit.

proc.name: get_report
proc.summary: Returns the currently set JUnit API output location (see: set_report).

proc.name: get_results
proc.summary: Returns the in-memory results, this is a ::struct::graph name. The name of a struct graph is a procedure and is used to configure and retrieve data from the graph object.

proc.name: graph_to_xml
proc.summary: Converts a struct::graph object directly to xml.

proc.name: new_error
proc.summary: Create a new node 'error' in the provided results object. Added under the provided parent node (testcase).

proc.name: new_failure
proc.summary: Create a new node 'failure' in the provided results object. Added under the provided parent node (testcase).

proc.name: new_stderr
proc.summary: Create a new node 'stderr' in the provided results object. Added under the provided parent node (testsuite).

proc.name: new_stdout
proc.summary: Create a new node 'stdout' in the provided results object. Added under the provided parent node (testsuite).

proc.name: new_testcase
proc.summary: Create a new node 'testcase' in the provided results object. Added under the provided parent node (testsuite).

proc.name: new_testsuite
proc.summary: Create a new node 'testsuite' in the provided results object. Added under the provided parent node (testsuites).

proc.name: new_testsuites
proc.summary: Create a new node 'testsuites' in the provided results object.

proc.name: process_impl_design
proc.summary: Used to process an implemented design. Runs validate_timing validate_routing validate_drcs validate_messages

proc.name: process_runs
proc.summary: Used to post-process runs. This requires using the project managed runs infrastructure Runs the following validations on each run: validate_run_properties validate_messages process_impl_design _or_ process_synth_design

proc.name: process_synth_design
proc.summary: Used to process an synthesized design. Runs validate_logic validate_drcs validate_messages

proc.name: reset_results
proc.summary: Resets the in-memory results, if it exists.

proc.name: run_command
proc.summary: Used to wrap any command while logging success, errors, and runtime.

proc.name: run_silent
proc.summary: Used to wrap any command while logging errors _only_. A JUnitXml entry is not created on success!

proc.name: run_step
proc.summary: Used to wrap a run-step while logging success, errors, and run-times. Runs the following validations after: validate_messages validate_drcs

proc.name: set_report
proc.summary: Configures the JUnit API output location.

proc.name: set_stderr
proc.summary: Adds a stderr entry to the global testsuite and sets it's content.

proc.name: set_stdout
proc.summary: Adds a stdout entry to the global testsuite and sets it's content.

proc.name: validate_drcs
proc.summary: Checks if any DRC Violations are found.

proc.name: validate_logic
proc.summary: Checks for driver-less nets and latches.

proc.name: validate_messages
proc.summary: Checks if Warnings, Critical Warnings, or Errors exist. If Errors are found, then the process is stopped (Tcl error).

proc.name: validate_routing
proc.summary: Checks for unrouted nets.

proc.name: validate_run_properties
proc.summary: Logs run walltime. Validates the run is at 100% progress, else logs error and stops process.

proc.name: validate_timing
proc.summary: Checks for paths with negative slack.

proc.name: write
proc.summary: Write out the output content to a file.

proc.name: write_results
proc.summary: Write the in-memory results to disk (uses the set_report/get_report location).
